DataElement.preferredName: Person Clinical Study Treatment Begin Identifier Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to capture the unique identifier(s) of person having begun treatment as part of clinical trial(s), research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Clinical Study Treatment Begin Identifier Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a unique identifier of person having begun treatment as part of clinical trial, research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Clinical Study Therapy Begin Identifier Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the unique identifier for a person on a clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Enter the treatment protocol
ReferenceDocuments.description: Enter the treatment protocol number(s) followed by the patient's sequence number(s) on the treatment protocol(s)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is registered to a treatment trial, enter the treatment protocol number(s) followed by the ECOG patient ID on the treatment protocol(s).  Others enter 'N/A'.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has been registered on a previous ECOG trial, enter the treatment protocol number(s) followed by the ECOG patient ID on the treatment protocol(s). Others enter 'N/A'.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is registered to a treatment trial, enter the treatment protocol number(s) followed by the ECOG-ACRIN patient ID on the treatment protocol(s). Others enter 'N/A'.
